trans-unit.source: Connect multiple on-premises sites to a virtual network
trans-unit.target: Connect multiple on-premises sites to a virtual network

trans-unit.source: This article will walk you through connecting multiple local on-premises sites to a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: This article will walk you through connecting multiple local on-premises sites to a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Connect multiple on-premises sites to a virtual network
trans-unit.target: Connect multiple on-premises sites to a virtual network

trans-unit.source: You can connect multiple on-premises sites to a single virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You can connect multiple on-premises sites to a single virtual network.

trans-unit.source: This is especially attractive for building hybrid cloud solutions.
trans-unit.target: This is especially attractive for building hybrid cloud solutions.

trans-unit.source: Creating a multi-site connection to your Azure virtual network gateway is very similar to creating other site-to-site connections.
trans-unit.target: Creating a multi-site connection to your Azure virtual network gateway is very similar to creating other site-to-site connections.

trans-unit.source: In fact, you can use an existing Azure VPN gateway, provided you have a route-based (or dynamic routing) VPN gateway configured for your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: In fact, you can use an existing Azure VPN gateway, provided you have a route-based (or dynamic routing) VPN gateway configured for your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: If your gateway is policy-based (or static routing), you can always change the gateway type without needing to rebuild the virtual network to accommodate multi-site, although you will also need to ensure your on-premises VPN gateway supports route-based VPN configurations.
trans-unit.target: If your gateway is policy-based (or static routing), you can always change the gateway type without needing to rebuild the virtual network to accommodate multi-site, although you will also need to ensure your on-premises VPN gateway supports route-based VPN configurations.

trans-unit.source: You'll then just add configuration settings to the network configuration file, and create multiple VPN connections from your virtual network to additional sites.
trans-unit.target: You'll then just add configuration settings to the network configuration file, and create multiple VPN connections from your virtual network to additional sites.

trans-unit.source: Multi-Site VPN
trans-unit.target: Multi-Site VPN

trans-unit.source: Points to consider
trans-unit.target: Points to consider

trans-unit.source: You won't be able to use the Management Portal to make changes to this virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You won't be able to use the Management Portal to make changes to this virtual network.

trans-unit.source: For this release, you'll need to make changes to the network configuration file instead of using the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: For this release, you'll need to make changes to the network configuration file instead of using the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: If you make changes in the Management Portal, they'll overwrite your multi-site reference settings for this virtual network.
trans-unit.target: If you make changes in the Management Portal, they'll overwrite your multi-site reference settings for this virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You should feel pretty comfortable using the network configuration file by the time you've completed the multi-site procedure.
trans-unit.target: You should feel pretty comfortable using the network configuration file by the time you've completed the multi-site procedure.

trans-unit.source: However, if you have multiple people working on your network configuration, you'll need to make sure that everyone knows about this limitation.
trans-unit.target: However, if you have multiple people working on your network configuration, you'll need to make sure that everyone knows about this limitation.

trans-unit.source: This doesn't mean that you can't use the Management Portal at all.
trans-unit.target: This doesn't mean that you can't use the Management Portal at all.

trans-unit.source: You can use it for everything else except making configuration changes to this particular virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You can use it for everything else except making configuration changes to this particular virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin
trans-unit.target: Before you begin

trans-unit.source: Before you begin configuration, verify that you have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin configuration, verify that you have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you don't already have an Azure subscription, you can activate your [MSDN subscriber benefits](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/) or sign up for a [free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you don't already have an Azure subscription, you can activate your [MSDN subscriber benefits](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/) or sign up for a [free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: Compatible VPN hardware for each on-premises location.
trans-unit.target: Compatible VPN hardware for each on-premises location.

trans-unit.source: Check [About VPN Devices for Virtual Network Connectivity](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=615099) to verify if the device that you want to use is something that is known to be compatible.
trans-unit.target: Check [About VPN Devices for Virtual Network Connectivity](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=615099) to verify if the device that you want to use is something that is known to be compatible.

trans-unit.source: An externally facing public IPv4 IP address for each VPN device.
trans-unit.target: An externally facing public IPv4 IP address for each VPN device.

trans-unit.source: The IP address cannot be located behind a NAT.
trans-unit.target: The IP address cannot be located behind a NAT.

trans-unit.source: This is requirement.
trans-unit.target: This is requirement.

trans-unit.source: The latest version of Azure PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: The latest version of Azure PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: You can download and install the latest version from the Windows PowerShell section of the [Downloads](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/) page.
trans-unit.target: You can download and install the latest version from the Windows PowerShell section of the [Downloads](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/) page.

trans-unit.source: Someone who is proficient at configuring your VPN hardware.
trans-unit.target: Someone who is proficient at configuring your VPN hardware.

trans-unit.source: You won't be able to use the auto-generated VPN scripts from the Management Portal to configure your VPN devices.
trans-unit.target: You won't be able to use the auto-generated VPN scripts from the Management Portal to configure your VPN devices.

trans-unit.source: This means you'll have to have a strong understanding of how to configure your VPN device, or work with someone who does.
trans-unit.target: This means you'll have to have a strong understanding of how to configure your VPN device, or work with someone who does.

trans-unit.source: The IP address ranges that you want to use for your virtual network (if you haven't already created one).
trans-unit.target: The IP address ranges that you want to use for your virtual network (if you haven't already created one).

trans-unit.source: The IP address ranges for each of the local network sites that you'll be connecting to.
trans-unit.target: The IP address ranges for each of the local network sites that you'll be connecting to.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to make sure that the IP address ranges for each of the local network sites that you want to connect to do not overlap.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to make sure that the IP address ranges for each of the local network sites that you want to connect to do not overlap.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the Management Portal or the REST API will reject the configuration being uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the Management Portal or the REST API will reject the configuration being uploaded.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have two local network sites that both contain the IP address range 10.2.3.0/24 and you have a package with a destination address 10.2.3.3, Azure wouldn't know which site you want to send the package to because the address ranges are overlapping.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have two local network sites that both contain the IP address range 10.2.3.0/24 and you have a package with a destination address 10.2.3.3, Azure wouldn't know which site you want to send the package to because the address ranges are overlapping.

trans-unit.source: To prevent routing issues, Azure doesn't allow you to upload a configuration file that has overlapping ranges.
trans-unit.target: To prevent routing issues, Azure doesn't allow you to upload a configuration file that has overlapping ranges.

trans-unit.source: Create your virtual network and gateway
trans-unit.target: Create your virtual network and gateway

trans-unit.source: Create a site-to-site VPN with a dynamic routing gateway.
trans-unit.target: Create a site-to-site VPN with a dynamic routing gateway.

trans-unit.source: If you already have one, great!
trans-unit.target: If you already have one, great!

trans-unit.source: You can proceed to [Export the virtual network configuration settings](#export).
trans-unit.target: You can proceed to [Export the virtual network configuration settings](#export).

trans-unit.source: If not, do the following:
trans-unit.target: If not, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Change your gateway type to dynamic routing.
trans-unit.target: Change your gateway type to dynamic routing.

trans-unit.source: A multi-site VPN requires a dynamic routing gateway.
trans-unit.target: A multi-site VPN requires a dynamic routing gateway.

trans-unit.source: To change your gateway type, you'll need to first delete the existing gateway, then create a new one.
trans-unit.target: To change your gateway type, you'll need to first delete the existing gateway, then create a new one.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Change a VPN Gateway Routing Type](vpn-gateway-configure-vpn-gateway-mp.md/#how-to-change-your-vpn-gateway-type).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Change a VPN Gateway Routing Type](vpn-gateway-configure-vpn-gateway-mp.md/#how-to-change-your-vpn-gateway-type).

trans-unit.source: Configure your new gateway and create your VPN tunnel.
trans-unit.target: Configure your new gateway and create your VPN tunnel.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Configure a VPN Gateway in the Management Portal](vpn-gateway-configure-vpn-gateway-mp.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Configure a VPN Gateway in the Management Portal](vpn-gateway-configure-vpn-gateway-mp.md).

trans-unit.source: Create your site-to-site virtual network using these instructions: [Create a Virtual Network with a Site-to-Site VPN Connection in the Management Portal](vpn-gateway-site-to-site-create.md).
trans-unit.target: Create your site-to-site virtual network using these instructions: [Create a Virtual Network with a Site-to-Site VPN Connection in the Management Portal](vpn-gateway-site-to-site-create.md).

trans-unit.source: Configure a dynamic routing gateway using these instructions: [Configure a VPN Gateway in the Management Portal](vpn-gateway-configure-vpn-gateway-mp.md).
trans-unit.target: Configure a dynamic routing gateway using these instructions: [Configure a VPN Gateway in the Management Portal](vpn-gateway-configure-vpn-gateway-mp.md).

trans-unit.source: Be sure to select **dynamic routing** for your gateway type.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to select **dynamic routing** for your gateway type.

trans-unit.source: Export the virtual network configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: Export the virtual network configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: To export your network configuration file, see [To export your network settings](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-using-network-configuration-file.md#export-and-import-virtual-network-settings-using-the-management-portal).
trans-unit.target: To export your network configuration file, see [To export your network settings](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-using-network-configuration-file.md#export-and-import-virtual-network-settings-using-the-management-portal).

trans-unit.source: The file that you export will be used to configure your new multi-site settings.
trans-unit.target: The file that you export will be used to configure your new multi-site settings.

trans-unit.source: Open your network configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Open your network configuration file.

trans-unit.source: Open the network configuration file that you downloaded in the last step.
trans-unit.target: Open the network configuration file that you downloaded in the last step.

trans-unit.source: Use any xml editor that you like.
trans-unit.target: Use any xml editor that you like.

trans-unit.source: The file should look similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The file should look similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Add multiple site references to the network configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Add multiple site references to the network configuration file.

trans-unit.source: When you add or remove site reference information, you'll make configuration changes to the ConnectionsToLocalNetwork/LocalNetworkSiteRef.
trans-unit.target: When you add or remove site reference information, you'll make configuration changes to the ConnectionsToLocalNetwork/LocalNetworkSiteRef.

trans-unit.source: Adding a new local site reference triggers Azure to create a new tunnel.
trans-unit.target: Adding a new local site reference triggers Azure to create a new tunnel.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the network configuration is for a single-site connection.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the network configuration is for a single-site connection.

trans-unit.source: To add additional site references (create a multi-site configuration), simply add additional "LocalNetworkSiteRef" lines, as shown in the example below:
trans-unit.target: To add additional site references (create a multi-site configuration), simply add additional "LocalNetworkSiteRef" lines, as shown in the example below:

trans-unit.source: Save the network configuration file and import it.
trans-unit.target: Save the network configuration file and import it.

trans-unit.source: To import the network configuration file, see [To import your network settings](../virtual-network/../virtual-network/virtual-networks-using-network-configuration-file.md#export-and-import-virtual-network-settings-using-the-management-portal).
trans-unit.target: To import the network configuration file, see [To import your network settings](../virtual-network/../virtual-network/virtual-networks-using-network-configuration-file.md#export-and-import-virtual-network-settings-using-the-management-portal).

trans-unit.source: When you import this file with the changes, the new tunnels will be added.
trans-unit.target: When you import this file with the changes, the new tunnels will be added.

trans-unit.source: The tunnels will use the dynamic gateway that you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: The tunnels will use the dynamic gateway that you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Download the pre-shared keys for the VPN tunnels.
trans-unit.target: Download the pre-shared keys for the VPN tunnels.

trans-unit.source: Once your new tunnels have been added, use the PowerShell cmdlet Get-AzureVNetGatewayKey to get the IPsec/IKE pre-shared keys for each tunnel.
trans-unit.target: Once your new tunnels have been added, use the PowerShell cmdlet Get-AzureVNetGatewayKey to get the IPsec/IKE pre-shared keys for each tunnel.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: If you prefer, you can also use the *Get Virual Network Gateway Shared Key* REST API to get the pre-shared keys.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer, you can also use the *Get Virual Network Gateway Shared Key* REST API to get the pre-shared keys.

trans-unit.source: Verify your connections
trans-unit.target: Verify your connections

trans-unit.source: Check the multi-site tunnel status.
trans-unit.target: Check the multi-site tunnel status.

trans-unit.source: After downloading the keys for each tunnel, you'll want to verify connections.
trans-unit.target: After downloading the keys for each tunnel, you'll want to verify connections.

trans-unit.source: Use *Get-AzureVnetConnection* to get a list of virtual network tunnels, as shown in the example below.
trans-unit.target: Use *Get-AzureVnetConnection* to get a list of virtual network tunnels, as shown in the example below.

trans-unit.source: VNet1 is the name of the VNet.
trans-unit.target: VNet1 is the name of the VNet.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: To learn more about VPN Gateways, see [About VPN Gateways](../vpn-gateway/vpn-gateway-about-vpngateways.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about VPN Gateways, see [About VPN Gateways](../vpn-gateway/vpn-gateway-about-vpngateways.md).
